description: Examine the construction of Greek national identity and cultural heritage through dance, embodied practices, and art creation practices by utilizing dance studies frameworks and ethnographic research tools. Experiential multi-sited research to be completed in Greece, conducted through dance workshops, performances, museum visits, attendance to regional dance festivals, and in conversation with local experts featured as guest lecturers, such as dance historians, folklorists, choreographers, teachers, and performers. Genres covered include folk dance, social dance, concert dance, and other somatic practices that foster a sense of belonging, community, and unity amongst practitioners. Must have sophomore standing and a valid passport that does not expire 6 months past the Greece travel dates.
